4.15.text:
Five years ago, a combination of the Global
Financial Crisis and poor government-decision-making

15.19.text:
Government spending under Labour had risen
by 50% in five years.

20.37.text:
Families were battling high inflation and
mortgage rates of over 10%.

25.12.text:
One in five teenagers were leaving school
unable to read and write properly.

32.33.text: That was when voters turned to National.

36.90.text: They wanted greater security, and better prospects.

40.24.text:
They wanted policies that they knew made economic
sense.

44.88.text: The day after we were elected, we got to work.

47.19.text: And we haven't stopped working since.

49.19.text:
A Global Financial Crisis and devastating
earthquakes would have knocked back the most

54.21.text:
robust of economies, and the most resilient
of people.

58.20.text:
But the Government and New Zealanders have
persevered.

62.13.text:
We have worked together and it's that combination
of effort and direction which has got us to

67.10.text: the much stronger position we enjoy today.

72.53.text:
The economy is growing, and forecast to be
among the top handful of countries for growth

81.86.text: And so are mortgage interest rates.

83.88.text: The government is on track to surplus.

86.58.text:
We've made big improvements to the public
services families rely on -- like healthcare

92.85.text:
More surgery is happening than ever before,
and if you have children at primary school,

97.82.text:
under our government you are actually entitled
to know how they're going.

102.21.text:
It's taken five years to reach this point,
and there is so much more improvement to come.

107.27.text: Our clear four-point plan is working.

110.35.text:
We're responsibly managing the government's
finances, because that's our job.

114.97.text:
We're building a more competitive and productive
economy, because that will provide more opportunities

120.31.text:
for job-seekers whether they're just entering
the workforce, or whether they're gradually

126.55.text:
It will also provide more security for all
of us, and our children.

131.34.text:
We're rebuilding Christchurch because it needs
to be done.

134.91.text:
And we're delivering better public services,
because you and your family deserve better

142.55.text:
We know things are still tough for lots of
people, but five years after we were first

147.97.text:
elected, the economy is in much better shape,
prospects are good, and the future is brighter.
